meanings.definition: The act of hijacking an aircraft in flight.
meanings.sent1: The skyjacking of the plane was a dangerous crime.
meanings.sent2: The news reported a skyjacking incident last night.
meanings.sent3: The skyjacking of the aircraft was like a scene from an action movie.
meanings.sent4: The skyjacking of the plane sent shockwaves through the aviation industry.
meanings.sent5: The skyjacking left passengers terrified and stranded in the air.

meanings.definition: To take control of an aircraft in flight by force.
meanings.sent1: The criminals attempted to skyjack the plane but were apprehended.
meanings.sent2: Pilots train rigorously to prevent anyone from skyjacking their aircraft.
meanings.sent3: The birds in the sky joked about skyjacking a passing airplane.
meanings.sent4: The storm seemed to skyjack the plane, causing turbulence and panic.
meanings.sent5: The hijackers tried to skyjack the aircraft, but the crew fought back bravely.
